title.value: Особенности морфогенеза перца сладкого (Capsicum annium L.) в культуре in vitro
Effect of different factors on morphogenesis of sweet pepper (Capsicum annuum L.) in culture in vitro

journal.title: Vegetable Growing : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Kilchevskij, A.V., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Institute of Genetics and Cytology
Moiseeva, M.O., Belarus State Academy of Agriculture, Gorki (Belarus)

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there was analyzed the morphogenetic potential of sweet pepper (Capsicum annuum L.) in culture in vitro. There was provided information on how to sterilize the seeds of sweet pepper with the introduction of the culture in vitro, depending on the type of primary callus and explants of the studied genotypes. There was shown the influence of the hormonal composition of the nutrient medium and the spectral composition of light on regeneration of sweet pepper in culture in vitro. In course of the study it was revealed that the consistent application of mercuric chloride and calcium hypochlorite produced a high percentage of sterile seeds. For callusogenesis of sweet pepper in vitro culture it was efficient to use cotyledon segments, since this type of callus explant was formed by all the studied lines. When cultured on a nutrient medium containing 0.5 mg / l indoleacetic acid, 1.0 mg / L kinetin and 1.0 mg / l 6-benzyladenine, as well on a medium containing 0.5 mg / l indoleacetic acid and 1.0 mg / l 6-benzylaminopurine it possible to receive organogenesis from cotyledon segments.
